meta.name: Automated Meeting Summaries: Google Meet to Slack with Vexa.ai and GPT-4o

parameters.text:
=# Fast Meeting Summary Prompt

Analyze this meeting transcription and create a brief Slack summary. Keep it under 800 characters total.

**Meeting Transcript:**
{{ $json.fullTranscript }}

**Meeting Details:**
- Duration: {{ $json.durationMinutes }} minutes
- Participants: {{ $json.participants }}

**Format (be extremely concise):**

## üìã Meeting Summary
**Duration:** [Start-End time]
**Participants:** [Names only]

**üéØ Key Points:**
- [Main topic 1]
- [Main topic 2]

**üìù Action Items:**
- [Task - Person - Deadline]

**üí° Outcome:**
[One sentence summary of result/decision]

Keep each bullet point under 50 characters. Focus only on actionable information and key decisions.

parameters.content:
## üìã Prerequisites & Requirements

**Required Accounts:**
- Google Calendar API access (free)
- Vexa.ai account with API key
- OpenAI API account with credits
- Slack workspace admin access

**Required Permissions:**
- Google Calendar: Read calendar events
- Slack: Post messages to channels
- Vexa.ai: Create bots and access transcripts

**Estimated Setup Time:** 15-20 minutes
**Cost:** ~$0.01-0.05 per meeting (OpenAI costs)

## üóìÔ∏è Google Calendar Setup

**Steps:**
1. Go to Google Cloud Console
2. Enable Calendar API
3. Create credentials (OAuth2)
4. Add credentials to n8n
5. Test connection

**Configuration:**
- Select your target calendar from list
- Set trigger to 'eventStarted'
- Ensure calendar has Meet links

**‚ö†Ô∏è Important:** Only works with Google Meet links in calendar events

## ü§ñ Vexa.ai Setup

**Get API Key:**
1. Sign up at vexa.ai
2. Navigate to API settings
3. Generate new API key
4. Add to n8n credentials

**Bot Configuration:**
- Platform: 'google_meet'
- Bot name: Customize as needed
- Meeting ID: Auto-extracted from calendar

**Rate Limits:**
- 100 requests/hour on free tier
- Bot joins 30-60 seconds after meeting starts

## üß† OpenAI + Slack Setup

**OpenAI Configuration:**
- Model: chatgpt-4o-latest (recommended)
- Cost: ~$0.01-0.05 per summary
- Add API key to n8n credentials

**Slack Bot Setup:**
1. Create Slack app in workspace
2. Add bot token scopes: chat:write
3. Install app to workspace
4. Add bot to target channel
5. Copy bot token to n8n

**Channel Format:** Use channel name or ID

## üîë Credential Setup Guide

**Before using this workflow:**

**1. Google Calendar OAuth2:**
- Go to Google Cloud Console
- Enable Calendar API
- Create OAuth2 credentials
- Add to n8n: Google Calendar OAuth2 API

**2. Vexa.ai API (HTTP Header Auth):**
- Sign up at vexa.ai
- Get API key from dashboard  
- Create HTTP Header Auth credential
- Header name: 'X-API-Key'
- Header value: Your API key

**3. OpenAI API:**
- Get API key from OpenAI platform
- Add to n8n: OpenAI API credential
- Ensure account has sufficient credits

**4. Slack Bot Token:**
- Create Slack app in your workspace
- Add bot token scopes: chat:write, channels:read
- Install app to workspace
- Add bot to target channel
- Copy bot token to n8n: Slack API credential

**‚ö†Ô∏è Test each credential** before running the full workflow!
